title: Problem Overview
content: Erdős Problem #884: Is the all-pairs divisor gap sum bounded by the consecutive-pairs sum? For divisors d_1 < ... < d_t of n, compare Σ_{i<j} 1/(d_j-d_i) with 1 + Σ_i 1/(d_{i+1}-d_i). OPEN. From [Er98], related to Problem #144.
mathContext: The left side has O(τ²) terms, the right has O(τ) terms. The conjecture asks for an absolute constant bound.

title: Divisor Lists
content: divisorList(n): sorted list of divisors via n.divisors.sort. numDivisors(n) = n.divisors.card (τ function). divisor(n,i): 0-indexed accessor. divisorList_sorted (axiom): strict ordering. mem_divisorList_iff (axiom): membership characterization.
mathContext: Uses Mathlib's Nat.divisors and List.sort. The sorted list d_1 < d_2 < ... < d_t is the fundamental object.

title: Divisor Gaps
content: consecutiveGap(n,i) = divisor(n,i+1) - divisor(n,i). generalGap(n,i,j) = divisor(n,j) - divisor(n,i). consecutiveGap_pos (axiom): gaps are positive for n > 1. generalGap_pos (axiom): same for i < j.
mathContext: Consecutive gaps are the building blocks; every general gap d_j - d_i is a sum of consecutive gaps (telescoping).

title: The Two Sums
content: allPairsSum(n): Σ over all i < j of 1/(d_j - d_i), using Finset.Ioo. consecutivePairsSum(n): Σ over i of 1/(d_{i+1} - d_i), using Finset.range.
mathContext: The all-pairs sum has C(τ,2) terms; the consecutive-pairs sum has τ-1 terms. The conjecture compares them.

title: Main Conjecture (OPEN)
content: ErdosConjecture884: ∃ C > 0, ∀ n > 1, allPairsSum(n) ≤ C(1 + consecutivePairsSum(n)). erdos_884 (axiom): the conjecture. Problem remains OPEN.
mathContext: The central question: is the all-pairs sum controlled by the consecutive-pairs sum with an absolute constant?

title: Basic Properties and Examples
content: allPairsSum_nonneg and consecutivePairsSum_nonneg (axioms). consecutivePairsSum_num_terms (proved: simp). divisors_6 and divisors_prime (axioms). prime_case_equality (axiom): for primes, both sums equal 1/(p-1).
mathContext: Both sums are non-negative. The prime case is trivial since there is only one pair of divisors.

title: Structural Lemmas and Connections
content: gap_lower_bound (axiom): generalGap ≥ consecutiveGap. numDivisors_mul_coprime (axiom): τ(mn) = τ(m)τ(n) for coprime m,n. divisorHarmonicSum: σ_{-1}(n) = Σ_{d|n} 1/d. Connection to Problem #144.
mathContext: The gap lower bound explains why the conjecture might hold: larger gaps yield smaller reciprocals. Multiplicativity of τ affects gap structure.

title: Summary: OPEN
content: erdos_884_statement (proved): ErdosConjecture884 ↔ ∃ C > 0, ∀ n > 1, allPairsSum(n) ≤ C(1 + consecutivePairsSum(n)). Proved by rfl. erdos_884_status (proved): True. Problem remains OPEN.
mathContext: The rfl proof confirms the conjecture definition matches the informal statement.
